title: Design Systems Handbook
description: This book guides readers through best practices around planning, designing, building, and implementing a design system, with insights and first-hand experiences from experts who have gone through the journey.

title: Carbon Design System
description: IBM's Carbon design system. Extremely comprehensive, with guidelines supporting multiple technical implementations. A design system operating at a massive scale.

title: The Web's Grain
description: A classic talk/article from Frank Chimero exploring the unique characteristics of the Web as a material to design with.

title: More Inclusive Design Systems Lead to Better Experiences
description: Design systems that establish an inclusive experience and contain patterns that are accessible keep bad practices from propagating across the organization’s digital experiences.

title: What is a mental model and how does it relate to user experience?
description: When it comes to UX design, understanding users’ mental models helps you make better design decisions in order to produce intuitive and engaging experiences for them.

title: How design systems use Storybook
description: A roundup of the best Storybook techniques from leading design systems

title: Accessibility drives aesthetics
description: A good demolition of the position that to create an accessible UI, you have to sacrifice aesthetics. In fact, designing for accessibility often makes things more aesthetically successful.

title: The Myths of Color Contrast Accessibility
description: Some killer, real-world advice about colour accessibility.

title: And You Thought Buttons Were Easy?
description: A slightly hyperbolic example of how much duplicate design work can cost. It does give a good illustration of how complex digital design can get, though.

title: InVision Design Maturity Report
description: InVision's look at the state of the (tech) design industry. The model of design maturity treats design systems as table stakes.

title: The Language of Modular Design
description: An introduction to designing using modular components to create more complex layouts

title: Atomic Design
description: The already classic book by Brad Frost. Chapter 1 is a particularly good intro to a systems-based design approach.

title: How we document components and patterns in the GOV.UK Design System
description: Overview of the documentation used to support the GOV.UK Design System.

title: A comprehensive guide to design systems
description: Introduction to the general concepts and processes involved in creating Design Systems. Also has a good list of links for futher reading.

title: Building Flexible Design Systems - The Design & Content Conference
description: Yesenia Perez-Cruz presents a case study of how Vox used a design system across their brands that helped to maintain, rather than stifle, creativity.
